## CES-D vs SAM

Harmony's innovative software tool provides an excellent platform to perform comparisons, including CES-D vs SAM. CES-D, the Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression, and SAM, also known as the Severe Aggression Measure, are both essential tools used in psychology research. Given that they both examine unique aspects of human behaviour and cognition, a comparative analysis between the two tools (CES-D vs SAM) provides insightful data. This comprehensive comparison of CES-D vs SAM and other combinations can be laborious and challenging without the right tool. That's where Harmony steps in. Its sophisticated use of natural language processing and generative AI models capacitates researchers to harmonise questionnaire items expertly and effectively, even if they are in different languages. Harmony offers an easy and efficient way to compare, contrast and analyse sets of data across different research tools. Thus, when conducting research comparisons as CES-D vs SAM, using Harmony ensures an easy and efficient harmonisation process. Just drag and drop your instruments into Harmony's web interface or select from its extensive database. Its large language models will provide percentage match comparison, giving you accurate and reliable results. Equipped with Harmony, psychologists can focus on interpreting and understanding these comparisons, ensuring a smooth process, reliable results, and ultimately, advancing our understanding of the human mind.

## Compare the items in CES-D English and SAM

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import CES-D and SAM into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just CES-D into Harmony</a> - compare CES-D English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SAM into Harmony</a> - compare SAM with other instruments
